reviews.review: 10 years worth all the build up. Even if you haven’t seen any of the Marvel Films before this it’s okay the Russo brothers catch you up to date. Great pace and you care more about the characters than any other film before. One Post credit scene in traditional Marvel films.
Good film, a few unexpected events that widened the eyes. Liked it a lot
A monumental achievement in blockbuster/superhero cinema!
Was very well written and executed on screen. It's going to be a very long year, waiting for Infinity War 2.
A great movie, for the most part, fantastic villain, great acting and standard marvel humor, looking forward to part two.
Not impressed at all, rather disappointing for Marvel.
Love it n hate it the culmination of 10 years totally worth it
Ending was flat.  Needed a little bit of segway.

WOW!!!!  If you expected the ending then good for you but the movie left people drained, pissed, sad, and shocked.  The action is almost non-stop so you end up drained by the time it is over.  And when it is over you just sort of sit there for a couple of minutes wondering if what you saw really happened on the screen.  Of course, then begins the what is next?  Marvel will sell out the first week of the next one, which will be something everyone is waiting for.

The movie is beautiful, going forward every major blockbuster will only dream of bringing in this many established characters to a universal threat.  The one-liners and comedy have become a staple to all Marvel films that assure audience members will want to return a second time. Thanos starts off with a bang, showing complete dominance over the heroes.  His early victory is a great way to show off the strength of a villain and establish doubt in the average viewer that gives credibility to Thanos.  

The first thirty mins of the movie feel like a mess.  It is a problem having too many main characters as it jumps around from Character group to character group.  The movie thrives as it focuses more on Thanos, it starts to build a villain you may not agree with but begin to understand.  Unfortunately, all the children of Thanos are not developed at all and virtually feel as pointless as a mindless minion.

This movie would have been improved on by focusing on developing Thanos and his children.  As Thanos and his children go about their evil deeds, then send in the heroes to stop them.  The heroes characters have already been established in their previous stories, but without additional context to the villains, the film's minor villains feel lost in the CGI. 

The most exciting part of this movie is the speculation of how the new Marvel storylines tie into the ending.  The ending has fueled my excitement at the Ant-Man and Wasp, Captain Marvel, and the next Infinity War movies.
